page.title: 19QUESTIONNAIRE END
page.content: 25% said that they have been burgled but only 3% mugged. The increase in the crime rate was blamed almost exclusively on unemployment and lack of discipline, primarily in the home. The work of the Police was felt by almost everyone to be satisfactory; very few voiced criticisms. 41% of the families attend a church regularly with 46% going to a Church of England and 41% attending a Nonconformist church. Other denominations given included Roman Catholic, Jewish and Jehovah's Witness, although altogether these accounted for only 13% of the total. Just over a half considered religion to be just as important today as it ever was but were unable to explain why.
